body.name: VOLENTEX 8 Inch Tablet, Android 13 Tablet PC 8GB(4+4GB Expand), 64GB ROM, 1TB Expand,1280x800 HD IPS Screen, 5000mAh Battery, Dual Cameras, Bluetooth, WiFi, and Type-C Port(Gray)
features: [High-performance tablet]: The VOLENTEX 8 inch Android 13 tablet is powered by the latest Android 13 operating system, 8GB(4+4 Expand) of RAM, and 64GB of ROM. It is equipped with a quad-core processor that ensures seamless performance when running multiple applications. In addition, with expandable memory of up to 1TB, storage space will never be an issue, making it ideal for leisure and work.

[Peace of mind choice]: The 8 inch tablet with Google's GMS certification, you can download a vast array of popular applications from the Google Play store, including Facebook, YouTube, and Netflix. Furthermore, the tablet features a 5000mAh battery that lasts up to 8 hours on mixed use, providing the convenience and assurance you need.

[Exceptional audio-visual experience]: The tablet features an 8-inch screen with a resolution of 1280×800 that provides vivid color display and is complemented by dual speakers to create an extraordinary audio-visual experience. Additionally, the screen can automatically adjust backlighting for optimal viewing.

[High-definition dual camera]: The tablet is equipped with dual cameras: a 2MP front-facing camera for video chat and an 8MP high-quality rear-facing camera for taking photos and videos at any time, capturing your beautiful moments.

[After-sales service]: Despite its powerful features, the mini tablet is lightweight and easy to carry around. Dear buyers, if you encounter any issues or have any concerns upon receiving or during use, please do not hesitate to contact us, and we will do our utmost to provide you with excellent service.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful Inexpensive Little Tablet
reviews.reviewText: I wasn’t sure what to expect since every tablet I own and my phone far exceed the specs on this 8-inch tablet. The more I have used it, and played around with it, I find that it has its purpose and I use it on a daily basis. Now it definitely does have some issues. My tablet did not come with a case as listed on the product page and mine appears to already have a screen protector installed on it because there is a piece of dust trapped underneath it. I copied the contents of another Android tablet to this one and to be honest between all the updates and the apps it took hours but once I was done everything was fine. The overall speed is good but not fast. The speakers are OK but not great. The WIFI and Bluetooth about average. It has useable images from both of its cameras. What really surprised me is that this comes with Android 13. Most tablets, even the more expensive ones are using earlier versions of the Android operating system. Every once in a while, the performance lags a little but that is probably because of all the notification and location services that I have running in the background. The fix is probably just to disable some of them. I never fully discharge the battery and my usage is between 4 and 5 hours and it handles it just fine. I study piano and I work at it daily. I replaced my iPad with this tablet because I really wanted a dedicated tablet that could handle a midi interface and this tablet does it and does it well. Having this tablet dedicated just to a single task saves me so much time from doing connections and setup. I’m getting a good solid performance from this tablet at a very budget friendly price. Expectations Met!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Performance and Very Affordable
reviews.reviewText: A few years ago, my first 8" tablet cost me five times the price of this one and it wasn't as powerful.I like this tablet because it's lightweight and high performance with a very clear display.It comes with Android 13 so it's up to date. The user interface is fast and very responsive.The screen responds quickly to my touch and there's no lag whatsoever.I really appreciate the audio socket because I prefer wired headphones rather than Bluetooth.Excellent Performance and Very Affordable.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! AAA+++

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars 8” tablet review: not a serious machine
reviews.reviewText: 8” Tablet reviewAs hard as it is to critique a tablet at this price, I’m gonna anyway.PROS:+It’s really inexpensive+Nice sized form factor. At 8” (screen diagonal) it’s almost pocketable.+Quite well made—smooth edges+Quite good screen. The ad says it’s IPS, and I have no reason to doubt it. But see below+Android 13 (!). Most cheap tablets are 12 or even 11.+Setup was easy, if rather slow (about 10 minutes)CONS:-Not much memory (because it’s inexpensive) though you can get more storage simply by putting an SSD card into it.-The screen looks good for simple backgrounds (icons on blue), but does not seem to be HD quality.-Ad says rear camera is 8MP. Doesn’t look like it to me. Picture is grainy and tracks really slowly and badly—when scanning the image blurs and stretches-Front camera is 2MP. Since that’s the one that would be showing my face on a Zoom call, people might think the low resolution is a good thing :-). But it’s not too usable-Performance is slow, really slow.NOTES:I’ve had a couple of these smaller Android tablets, including ones that were intended for kids (which is where I think this belongs) that have worked quite a bit better than this, albeit at a higher price and with a larger screen. I’ve actually been able to use such tablets for adult-level work such as word processing using open source apps. But I fear, not this tablet.SUMMARY:It’s pretty clear that this tablet is aimed at kids playing simple games. It’s not really suitable for much else, frankly, though I do like the 8” form factor; a bit like an underpowered iPad Mini. I might try it with an SSD inserted to see if that will boost performance (unlikely, unless I can get the tablet to use the extra memory for things like screen/camera buffering). Failing that, I might just try to use it as a larger screen for one of my RaspPi setups.It’s ok, and it’s cheap, but it’s not a serious machine for much else given its limitations.
